page.title: 07THE COLYTON FEOFFEES
page.content: The Feoffees are members of a charity which has contributed much to Colyton in the past. It all started when Henry Courtney, a cousin of Henry VIII, was convicted and beheaded for treason in 1539. He was Lord of the Manor of Colyton and his land was confiscated by the King. Some merchants sent a petition to Henry VIII to buy back the land and he granted their request. They were the first Feoffees. The rent from the land and property was used to help the poor including founding the Grammar School. Nowadays, the Feoffees cannot help out as much as they used to. In 1920, they sold all their land to make money for charity and to build a Feoffees Town Hall. If a person has a serious accident, they might give him a grant. In February they hold a banquet to celebrate the giving of the charter.
